qas.question: Who was the State Department giving money to?
Where had the money given to drug traffickers come from?

answers.text: funds authorized by the Congress for humanitarian assistance to the Contras

qas.question: How much money did the State Department give the traffickers?
What was the response to Kerry's accusation of funding traffickers?

answers.text: little reaction in the media and official Washington

context: The Kerry Committee report found that "the Contra drug links included..... payments to <a0_0>drug traffickers<a0_0/> by the U.S. State Department of <a1_0>funds authorized by the Congress for humanitarian assistance to the Contras<a1_0/>, in some cases after the traffickers had been indicted by federal law enforcement agencies on drug charges, in others while traffickers were under active investigation by these same agencies." The U.S. State Department paid <a2_0>over $806,000<a2_0/> to known drug traffickers to carry humanitarian assistance to the Contras. Kerry's findings provoked <a3_0>little reaction in the media and official Washington<a3_0/>.
